tel_ran.tests.generator

Class Testing_Problem

  • java.lang.Object
    • tel_ran.tests.generator.Testing_Problem
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    OneDimStringAnswers

    public abstract class Testing_Problem
extends java.lang.Object
    The most general abstract class representing any possible problem *

      • WhatKindOfProblem

        public int WhatKindOfProblem()
        Returns the integer corresponding to data kind describing problem or answers
        Returns:
        : 1 = Testing_Problem.ONE_DIM_STRING_ARRAY - one dimensional string array (ODSA) 2 = Testing_Problem.TWO_DIM_STRING_ARRAY - two dimensional string array (TDSA) 3 = Testing_Problem.ONE_DIM_PICTURE_ARRAY - one dimensional picture array (ODPA) 4 = Testing_Problem.TWO_DIM_PICTURE_ARRAY - two dimensional picture array (ODSA) 5 = Testing_Problem.THREE_DIM_PICTURE_ARRAY - three dimensional picture array (ODSA)

      • WhatKindOfAnswers

        public int WhatKindOfAnswers()
        Returns the integer corresponding to data kind describing problem or answers
        Returns:
        : 1 = Testing_Problem.ONE_DIM_STRING_ARRAY - one dimensional string array (ODSA) 2 = Testing_Problem.TWO_DIM_STRING_ARRAY - two dimensional string array (TDSA) 3 = Testing_Problem.ONE_DIM_PICTURE_ARRAY - one dimensional picture array (ODPA) 4 = Testing_Problem.TWO_DIM_PICTURE_ARRAY - two dimensional picture array (ODSA) 5 = Testing_Problem.THREE_DIM_PICTURE_ARRAY - three dimensional picture array (ODSA)

      • whatProblemFrames

        public int whatProblemFrames()
        method returns the Frames describing frames around and in problem and answer data
        Returns:
        : 0 = Frames. NO_FRAMES - no frames 1 = Frames. FRAME_OUT - frame around data 2 = Frames. ALL_FRAMES - frames around all data cells 3 = Frames. FRAMES_IF_FULL - frames around data cells if they are full *
        See Also:
        Frames

      • whatAnswerFrames

        public int whatAnswerFrames()
        method returns the Frames describing frames around and in problem and answer data
        Returns:
        : 0 = Frames. NO_FRAMES - no frames 1 = Frames. FRAME_OUT - frame around data 2 = Frames. ALL_FRAMES - frames around all data cells 3 = Frames. FRAMES_IF_FULL - frames around data cells if they are full *
        See Also:
        Frames

      • setProblemFrames

                             boolean all,
                             boolean if_full)
        method sets the frames around and in problem and answer data
        Parameters:
        out - - frame around data
        all - - frames around all data cells
        if_full - - frames around data cells if they are full
